case_vignette: An 8-year old boy is brought to the pediatrician by his distraught mother who is concerned about "light spots" that first appeared 4 months ago and have been slowly expanding over different parts of his body. He is not bothered by these areas, and they do not itch, burn, or bleed. He has otherwise been well. There is no family history of this skin condition, though his mother has a history of hypothyroidism. His skin exam is notable for smooth, hypopigmented patches over his bilateral knuckles, knees, and inner thighs, as seen in Figure A. His exam is also notable for a tuft of leukotrichia over his occiput, as seen in Figure B.
question: Which  will help to confirm the diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have light-colored spots on my skin that have been spreading over my knuckles, knees, and inner thighs.
What is your age and sex?
I'm an 8-year-old boy.
Have you noticed any changes in the texture or sensation of the affected skin areas, such as thinning or itching?
No, the areas don't itch, burn, or feel different at all.
How long have you been noticing these spots and have they changed in size or number since you first saw them?
They first appeared 4 months ago and have been slowly getting bigger over time.
Do you have a family history of any skin conditions or autoimmune disorders?
No skin conditions, but my mother has hypothyroidism.
Have you been exposed to any new skincare products, soaps, detergents, or had any recent infections or illnesses?
I've been otherwise well and haven't mentioned any new products, infections, or illnesses.
Have you been experiencing any other symptoms such as fatigue, joint pain, or abdominal discomfort?
No, I haven't had any other symptoms; I've been generally well.
Final Diagnosis: Vitiligo
